column4: i just plugged in a HDD via USB but it isnt showing up... how can i find it so i can mount it?
you need to use the "mount" sheel command
and tipe "sudo mount /dev/sd" and press the tabulation several times
yes, but i need to "mount /dev/[somethinghere]/ /media/blah/"... how do i get the something here part
when i do "sudo fdisk -l" i dont see it
yeah, i can hear it spin up when i plug it in
and it's not just this one drive, its all of my USB drives... :|
How... then that would be a problem of drivers I guess
And I can't help you with that, never had this kind of troubles
hrmm... maybe its this stupid IDE>USB adapter i have... let me try something else... brb
lol, actually these two drives are ones that i just found from like 2003, but yeah... almost the 90's. i'm sure i have some sweet pron on here... need to get it off and check it out!
Well, I have an IDE myself (first drive) and I never had problem with it... so, sorry :x
